page.title: 07Customs - Playground games
page.content: The school yard is marked with lines for tennis and rounders. One game we play is a game of chase called Line Tig, but you are only allowed to run on these lines. One person chases the others until someone is caught - then they are said to be "on" - they are now the chaser. Skipping games were popular at my Primary School. In one game a long piece of rope was turned by two children whilst others in turn jumped over the rope. The jumper chanted the following: Bumper car, bumper car, number 48, Take it round the corner, slam on the brakes. But the brakes don't work, so you take it to the garage. How many gallons do you need? (The number of jumps made). Other chants had names such as Banana Splits, England-Ireland, Ibble Obble, Mickey Mouse and Peter Pan.
